name: chicagotribune
text:
Hundreds gathered near Lighthouse Beach in Evanston today, days after a Confederate flag beach towel was seen there in a viral video.

“I have asked you all to come here today to make racist people uncomfortable,” speaker LaShandra Smith-Rayfield said. https://t.co/pxMkYLySM3

name: chicagotribune
text: The first two COVID-19 patients in the U.S. to undergo a double lung transplant spoke publicly about their experiences today at Northwestern. Here's what they had to say. https://t.co/Ic6gl18UGO

name: chicagotribune
text: Lollapalooza 2020 is still happening this weekend, and you don't even have to leave your house to watch. Here's where to stream the performances. https://t.co/tboZuuhuj0

name: chicagotribune
text: Although no final decision has been made on what instruction will look like in Chicago Public Schools this fall, parents learned Friday that they have a week to decide whether they will opt their children out of the proposed hybrid approach for fall. https://t.co/rjwIM6rxUr

name: chicagotribune
text: “It’s all about Ben now.” How members of the community are gathering to support an 11-year-old boy in Gary who lost his parents to domestic violence. https://t.co/ZMZCDRdShy
